original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~This is the day that the Lord has made...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says, "Now about food sacrificed to idols: We know that we all 
possess knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up...

The man who thinks he knows something does not yet know as
he ought to know...

But the man who loves God is known by God...

Our Lesson for Today:

Love is more important than knowledge. Oh yes knowledge can make
us look good and feel important, but we can all too easily develop an
arrogant, know-it-all attitude...

Many people with strong opinions are unwilling to listen to and learn
from God and others. We can obtain God's knowledge only by loving
Him. (see James 3:17, 18)...

And we can know and be known by God only when we model Him by 
showing love...(see, I John 4:7, 8)

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I ask that You would help me to 
love others, for love comes from You. No greater love 
has anyone than he lay down his life for another. Forgive 
me for not displaying a Christ-like love...Amen.

Keep looking up, looking to Jesus in faith...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Love is more important than knowledge. Oh yes knowledge can make us look good and feel important, but we can all too easily develop an arrogant, know-it-all attitude. Many people with strong opinions are unwilling to listen to and learn from God and others. We can obtain God's knowledge only by loving Him. (see James 3:17, 18). And we can know and be known by God only when we model Him by showing love. (see, I John 4:7, 8)
original_verse_text: Paul says, "Now about food sacrificed to idols: We know that we all possess knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up. The man who thinks he knows something does not yet know as he ought to know. But the man who loves God is known by God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing that love is more important than mere knowledge. Help us to guard against developing an arrogant, self-righteous attitude, and instead, to seek You with a spirit of meekness and gentleness. May we model Your love, Lord, and know You more deeply as we strive to love one another with patience and unity. Amen.
reflection: Love is more important than knowledge. Oh yes knowledge can make us look good and feel important, but we can all too easily develop an arrogant, know-it-all attitude. Many people with strong opinions are unwilling to listen to and learn from God and others. We can obtain God's knowledge only by loving Him. (see James 3:17, 18). And we can know and be known by God only when we model Him by showing love. (see, I John 4:7, 8)
subject: Loving God Leads to True Knowledge
verse_text: Paul says, "Now about food sacrificed to idols: We know that we all possess knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up. The man who thinks he knows something does not yet know as he ought to know. But the man who loves God is known by God.

original_content:
Have a blessed day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Open your bible prayerfully ~ read it carefully;
obey it joyfully...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

If anyone with a weak conscience sees you who have this knowledge
eating in an idol's temple, won't he be emboldened to eat what has been
sacrificed to idols?

So this weak brother, for whom Christ died, is destroyed by your knowledge.

When you sin against your brothers in this way and wound their weak 
conscience, you sin against Christ...

Therefore, it what I eat causes my brother to fall into sin, I will never eat
meat again, so that I will cause him to fall... (I Cor. 9:10-13) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Christian freedom does not mean that anything goes. It means
that our salvation is not obtained by good deeds or legalistic rules,
it is the free gift of God (Eph. 2:8, 9)...

Christian freedom, then, is inseparably tied to Christian responsibility.
New believers are often every sensitive to what is right or wrong,
what they should or shouldn't do...

Some actions may be perfectly alright for us to do but may harm
a Christian brother or sister who is still young in the faith and learning
what the Christian life is all about...

We need to be careful not to offend a sensitive or younger Christian
or, by example, cause him or her to sin...

When we love others, our freedom should be less important to us than
strengthening the faith of a brother or sister in Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for the times I have 
offended a brother or sister in Christ. Help me to always
be sensitive to the feelings of those who are new in the faith.
Bless all my e-mail friends with good health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking up, trust and obey...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Christian freedom does not mean that anything goes. It means that our salvation is not obtained by good deeds or legalistic rules, it is the free gift of God (Ephesians 2:8, 9). Christian freedom, then, is inseparably tied to Christian responsibility. New believers are often every sensitive to what is right or wrong, what they should or shouldn't do. Some actions may be perfectly alright for us to do but may harm a Christian brother or sister who is still young in the faith and learning what the Christian life is all about. We need to be careful not to offend a sensitive or younger Christian or, by example, cause him or her to sin. When we love others, our freedom should be less important to us than strengthening the faith of a brother or sister in Christ.
original_verse_text: If anyone with a weak conscience sees you who have this knowledge eating in an idol's temple, won't he be emboldened to eat what has been sacrificed to idols? So this weak brother, for whom Christ died, is destroyed by your knowledge. When you sin against your brothers in this way and wound their weak conscience, you sin against Christ. Therefore, it what I eat causes my brother to fall into sin, I will never eat meat again, so that I will cause him to fall.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the freedom You have graciously bestowed upon us through Your Son, Jesus Christ. Yet, we recognize that this freedom comes with a responsibility to love and care for our fellow believers, especially the young in faith. Help us, Lord, to be mindful of how our actions may impact others, and to willingly surrender our own desires for the sake of strengthening the faith of our brothers and sisters. May we always seek to build one another up, and never to cause a fellow Christian to stumble. We ask this in the name of our Savior, Jesus. Amen.
reflection: Christian freedom does not mean that anything goes. It means that our salvation is not obtained by good deeds or legalistic rules, it is the free gift of God (Ephesians 2:8, 9). Christian freedom, then, is inseparably tied to Christian responsibility. New believers are often every sensitive to what is right or wrong, what they should or shouldn't do. Some actions may be perfectly alright for us to do but may harm a Christian brother or sister who is still young in the faith and learning what the Christian life is all about. We need to be careful not to offend a sensitive or younger Christian or, by example, cause him or her to sin. When we love others, our freedom should be less important to us than strengthening the faith of a brother or sister in Christ.
subject: Embracing Christian Freedom with Responsibility
verse_text: If anyone with a weak conscience sees you who have this knowledge eating in an idol's temple, won't he be emboldened to eat what has been sacrificed to idols? So this weak brother, for whom Christ died, is destroyed by your knowledge. When you sin against your brothers in this way and wound their weak conscience, you sin against Christ. Therefore, it what I eat causes my brother to fall into sin, I will never eat meat again, so that I will cause him to fall.

original_content:
Keep Smiling!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Never let today's burden erase yesterday's blessings...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Paul says, "When I preach the Gospel, I cannot boast, for I am
compelled to preach. Woe to me if I did not preach the Gospel!"
(I Cor. 9:16) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Preaching the Good news was Paul's gift and calling, and he
says he couldn't stop preaching even if he wanted to...

Paul was driven to do what God wanted him to. Paul was driven
by the desire to do what God wanted; using the gifts for God's glory...

What special gifts has God given you?
Are you motivated, like Paul, to honor God with your gifts?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that you would motivate me
to use the gifts you have given me. I pray for Your guidance
to realize the gifts that I have...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is the great motivator...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...
original_reflection_text: Preaching the Good news was Paul's gift and calling, and he says he couldn't stop preaching even if he wanted to. Paul was driven to do what God wanted him to. Paul was driven by the desire to do what God wanted; using the gifts for God's glory. What special gifts has God given you? Are you motivated, like Paul, to honor God with your gifts?
original_verse_text: Paul says, "When I preach the Gospel, I cannot boast, for I am compelled to preach. Woe to me if I did not preach the Gospel!"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gifts and callings You have bestowed upon us. Like the apostle Paul, may we be driven by a desire to honor You and serve Your kingdom through the unique talents and abilities You have entrusted to us. Help us to recognize and cultivate these gifts, that we may use them faithfully to spread the Good News and bring glory to Your name. May our hearts be filled with the same passion and commitment that compelled Paul to preach the gospel, even when it was difficult. Guide us, Lord, to steward our gifts for Your purposes. Amen.
reflection: Preaching the Good news was Paul's gift and calling, and he says he couldn't stop preaching even if he wanted to. Paul was driven to do what God wanted him to. Paul was driven by the desire to do what God wanted; using the gifts for God's glory. What special gifts has God given you? Are you motivated, like Paul, to honor God with your gifts?
subject: Honoring God with Your Unique Gifts
verse_text: Paul says, "When I preach the Gospel, I cannot boast, for I am compelled to preach. Woe to me if I did not preach the Gospel!"

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Repentance not only says "I'm sorry,"
it also says "I will turn from my sins."

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says, "To the weak I became weak, to win the weak.
I have become all things to all men so that by all possible
means I might save some...

I do all this for the sake of the gospel, that I may share in 
its blessings...(I Cor. 9:22, 23) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul gives several important principals for ministering ~ or witnessing.
(1) Find common ground with those you contact...
(2) Avoid a know-it-all attitude...
(3) Make others feel acceptable...
(4) Be sensitive to their needs and concerns...
(5) Look for opportunities to tell them about Christ...

These principles are just as valid for us today as they were
for Paul in his day...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remember these five 
principals as I visit and witness to others, help me to be 
sensitive to their feelings and needs, I pray this in Jesus
name...Amen.

Keep looking up, with a sensitive heart...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Paul gives several important principals for ministering ~ or witnessing. (1) Find common ground with those you contact. (2) Avoid a know-it-all attitude. (3) Make others feel acceptable. (4) Be sensitive to their needs and concerns. (5) Look for opportunities to tell them about Christ. These principles are just as valid for us today as they were for Paul in his day.
original_verse_text: Paul says, "To the weak I became weak, to win the weak. I have become all things to all men so that by all possible means I might save some. I do all this for the sake of the gospel, that I may share in its blessings.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking to follow the example of the apostle Paul in our witness to the world. Grant us the wisdom to find common ground with those we encounter, to approach them with humility and sensitivity, and to speak words that build them up and point them to Your Son, Jesus Christ. May our lives be a reflection of Your love and grace, that many may come to know the saving power of the gospel. We ask this in the name of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Paul gives several important principals for ministering ~ or witnessing. (1) Find common ground with those you contact. (2) Avoid a know-it-all attitude. (3) Make others feel acceptable. (4) Be sensitive to their needs and concerns. (5) Look for opportunities to tell them about Christ. These principles are just as valid for us today as they were for Paul in his day.
subject: Principles for Effective Witnessing
verse_text: Paul says, "To the weak I became weak, to win the weak. I have become all things to all men so that by all possible means I might save some. I do all this for the sake of the gospel, that I may share in its blessings.

original_content:
Hey its Saturday!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~At times we may have to give up something 
good in order to do what God wants...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Do you not know that in a race all the runners run, but only one
gets the prize? Run in such a way as to get the prize...

Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training.
They do it to get a crown that will not last; but we do it to get a
crown that will last forever...

Therefore I do not run as a man running aimlessly; I do not
fight like a man beating the air...

No, I beat my body and make it a slave so that after I have
preached to others, I myself will not be disqualified for the
prize...(I Cor. 9:24-27) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Winning a race requires purpose and discipline. Paul uses 
this illustration to explain that a Christian life often takes hard 
work ~ self-denial ~ and grueling preparation...

As Christians, we are to be running toward our Heavenly reward. 
The essential disciplines of prayer ~ Bible Study ~ and worship 
equip us to run a successful race...

Don't remain on the bleachers ~ don't just turn out to jug a couple 
of laps each morning. Train diligently ~ your spiritual progress 
depends upon it...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would
continue to prod me on to the finish line ~ to that imperishable
eternal reward. I pray that my goal would always be pleasing to 
You...Amen.

Keep looking up, prayer is the link ~
between heaven and earth...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Winning a race requires purpose and discipline. Paul uses this illustration to explain that a Christian life often takes hard work ~ self-denial ~ and grueling preparation. As Christians, we are to be running toward our Heavenly reward. The essential disciplines of prayer ~ Bible Study ~ and worship equip us to run a successful race. Don't remain on the bleachers ~ don't just turn out to jug a couple of laps each morning. Train diligently ~ your spiritual progress depends upon it.
original_verse_text: Do you not know that in a race all the runners run, but only one gets the prize? Run in such a way as to get the prize. Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training. They do it to get a crown that will not last; but we do it to get a crown that will last forever. Therefore I do not run as a man running aimlessly; I do not fight like a man beating the air. No, I beat my body and make it a slave so that after I have preached to others, I myself will not be disqualified for the prize.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, recognizing the need for purpose and discipline in our Christian lives. Like the athletes in the race, help us to run with endurance, keeping our eyes fixed on Jesus, the author and perfecter of our faith. Grant us the strength to deny ourselves, to train diligently in prayer, Bible study, and worship, that we may finish the race and receive the imperishable crown. May we not be content with mere laps, but may we press on toward the goal, for Your glory. Amen.
reflection: Winning a race requires purpose and discipline. Paul uses this illustration to explain that a Christian life often takes hard work ~ self-denial ~ and grueling preparation. As Christians, we are to be running toward our Heavenly reward. The essential disciplines of prayer ~ Bible Study ~ and worship equip us to run a successful race. Don't remain on the bleachers ~ don't just turn out to jug a couple of laps each morning. Train diligently ~ your spiritual progress depends upon it.
subject: Winning the Spiritual Race Requires Discipline
verse_text: Do you not know that in a race all the runners run, but only one gets the prize? Run in such a way as to get the prize. Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training. They do it to get a crown that will not last; but we do it to get a crown that will last forever. Therefore I do not run as a man running aimlessly; I do not fight like a man beating the air. No, I beat my body and make it a slave so that after I have preached to others, I myself will not be disqualified for the prize.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~This is the day that the Lord has made.
let us rejoice and be glad in it...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

I do not want you to be ignorant of the fact, brothers, that our forefathers
were all under the cloud and that they all passed through the sea...

They were all baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea...

They all ate the same spiritual food, and drank the same spiritual drink;
for they drank from the spiritual rock that accompanied them, and that
rock was Christ...

Nevertheless, God was not pleased with most of them; their bodies 
were scattered over the desert...(I Cor. 10:1-5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The cloud and the sea mentioned here refer to Israel's escape
from slavery in Egypt when God led them by a cloud and brought 
them safely through the Red Sea (EX. 14)...

The miraculous food and water were the provisions God gave 
as they traveled through the wilderness (Ex. 15-16)...

"They were baptized in the cloud and the sea" means that
just as we are united with Christ by baptism, so the Israelites 
were united under Moses' leadership and the events of the
Exodus out of Egypt...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father I thank You for all the ways that
You make possible for all mankind to come into a living 
personal relationship with you. I thank you for Your Grace
and Love...Amen.

Keep looking up, in love and thankfulness...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: The cloud and the sea mentioned here refer to Israel's escape from slavery in Egypt when God led them by a cloud and brought them safely through the Red Sea (EX. 14). The miraculous food and water were the provisions God gave as they traveled through the wilderness (Exodus 15-16)."They were baptized in the cloud and the sea" means that just as we are united with Christ by baptism, so the Israelites were united under Moses' leadership and the events of the Exodus out of Egypt.
original_verse_text: I do not want you to be ignorant of the fact, brothers, that our forefathers were all under the cloud and that they all passed through the sea. They were all baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea. They all ate the same spiritual food, and drank the same spiritual drink; for they drank from the spiritual rock that accompanied them, and that rock was Christ. Nevertheless, God was not pleased with most of them; their bodies were scattered over the desert.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for Your mighty acts of deliverance, leading Your people through the cloud and the sea, providing for their every need in the wilderness. Just as You were faithful to the Israelites, may we too be united with Christ, baptized into His death and resurrection, and sustained by the spiritual food and drink that nourish our souls. Guide us, Lord, as we journey through this world, that we may remain steadfast in Your love. Amen.
reflection: The cloud and the sea mentioned here refer to Israel's escape from slavery in Egypt when God led them by a cloud and brought them safely through the Red Sea (EX. 14). The miraculous food and water were the provisions God gave as they traveled through the wilderness (Exodus 15-16)."They were baptized in the cloud and the sea" means that just as we are united with Christ by baptism, so the Israelites were united under Moses' leadership and the events of the Exodus out of Egypt.
subject: Baptized in Cloud and Sea
verse_text: I do not want you to be ignorant of the fact, brothers, that our forefathers were all under the cloud and that they all passed through the sea. They were all baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea. They all ate the same spiritual food, and drank the same spiritual drink; for they drank from the spiritual rock that accompanied them, and that rock was Christ. Nevertheless, God was not pleased with most of them; their bodies were scattered over the desert.

original_content:
Wed. 13th 08~~~(food for thought)~~~If God so loved us, we ought to love one another...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Do not be Idolaters as some of them were; as it is written:
"The people sat down to eat and drink and got up to indulge
in pagan revelry...

We should not commit sexual immorality, as some of them
did ~ and in one day 23,000 of them died...

We should not test the Lord, as some of them did ~ and were
killed by snakes...

And do not grumble, as some of them did ~ and were killed
by the destroying angel...

These things happened to them as examples and were written
down as a warning for us, on whom the fulfillment of the ages
has come...(I Cor. 10:7-11) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Today's pressures make it easy to ignore or forget the lessons of
the past. But Paul cautions us to remember the lessons the Israelites 
learned about God so we can avoid repeating their errors...

The key to remembering is to study the Bible regularly so that these
lessons remind us how God wants us to live...

We need not repeat their mistakes!

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always focus on Your will.
Forgive me for the sins of thought word and deed that I have 
committed. Sensitize my heart to Your Holy Spirit's teaching...Amen.

Keep looking up, with your eye on the future ~ and God's promises...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...
original_reflection_text: Today's pressures make it easy to ignore or forget the lessons of the past. But Paul cautions us to remember the lessons the Israelites learned about God so we can avoid repeating their errors. The key to remembering is to study the Bible regularly so that these lessons remind us how God wants us to live. We need not repeat their mistakes!
original_verse_text: Do not be Idolaters as some of them were; as it is written: "The people sat down to eat and drink and got up to indulge in pagan revelry. We should not commit sexual immorality, as some of them did ~ and in one day 23, 000 of them died. We should not test the Lord, as some of them did ~ and were killed by snakes. And do not grumble, as some of them did ~ and were killed by the destroying angel. These things happened to them as examples and were written down as a warning for us, on whom the fulfillment of the ages has come.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to learn from the wisdom of Your Word. Help us to heed the lessons of the past, that we may not fall into the same traps of idolatry and disobedience that ensnared Your people. Grant us the discipline to study Your Scriptures regularly, that we may be equipped to walk the path of righteousness and avoid the pitfalls that have ensnared others. May we ever cling to Your instruction, for it is the way of life. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Today's pressures make it easy to ignore or forget the lessons of the past. But Paul cautions us to remember the lessons the Israelites learned about God so we can avoid repeating their errors. The key to remembering is to study the Bible regularly so that these lessons remind us how God wants us to live. We need not repeat their mistakes!
subject: Lessons from Israel's Past
verse_text: Do not be Idolaters as some of them were; as it is written: "The people sat down to eat and drink and got up to indulge in pagan revelry. We should not commit sexual immorality, as some of them did ~ and in one day 23, 000 of them died. We should not test the Lord, as some of them did ~ and were killed by snakes. And do not grumble, as some of them did ~ and were killed by the destroying angel. These things happened to them as examples and were written down as a warning for us, on whom the fulfillment of the ages has come.

original_content:
Happy Valentines Day!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Write down your definition of love and then,
read I Cor. 13. How does your definition compare?

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Paul says, "These things happened to them (the Israelites) as 
examples and were written down as warnings for us, on whom 
the fulfillment of the age has come...(I Cor. 10:11) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The pressures we live under today makes it easy to forget the 
lessons of the past. But Paul cautions us to remember so that 
we do not make the same mistakes the Israelites made...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me remember to put You first 
each and every day. Instill in me a greater love for Your Word 
each and every day. Help me apply Your Word to my life...Amen.

Keep looking up, for His direction for your life...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: The pressures we live under today makes it easy to forget the lessons of the past. But Paul cautions us to remember so that we do not make the same mistakes the Israelites made.
original_verse_text: Paul says, "These things happened to them (the Israelites) as examples and were written down as warnings for us, on whom the fulfillment of the age has come.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the lessons of the past that Your Word provides. Help us to fix our eyes on Jesus, the author and perfecter of our faith, and to run the race of life with endurance, learning from the examples of those who have gone before us. May we not repeat the mistakes of the Israelites, but walk in obedience to Your will, ever mindful of the cloud of witnesses that surround us. Guide us, Lord, that we may finish the race set before us and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: The pressures we live under today makes it easy to forget the lessons of the past. But Paul cautions us to remember so that we do not make the same mistakes the Israelites made.
subject: Lessons from the Past to Guide Us Today
verse_text: Paul says, "These things happened to them (the Israelites) as examples and were written down as warnings for us, on whom the fulfillment of the age has come.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~To be blest you must be a blessing...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

If you think you are standing firm, be careful that you do not fall!

No temptation has seized you except what is common to man. And
God is faithful; He will not let you be tempted beyond what you 
can bear. But when you are tempted, He will also provide a way 
out so that so that you can stand up under it...(I Cor. 10:12, 13) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Like the Corinthians we are living in a culture that is morally depraved
with sin-inducing pressures...

Paul has some encouragement He says:

(1) Temptations happen to every one so don't feel you have been singled out.
(2) Others have resisted temptation, and so can you.
(3) Any temptation can be resisted because God will show you a way out.

God will help you in resisting temptation by helping you:

(1) Recognize those people and situations that give you trouble.
(2) Run from anything you know is wrong.
(3) Choose to do only what is right.
(4) Pray for God's help ~ and
(5) seek friends who love God and can offer help when you are tempted...

Running from a tempting situation is your first step on the way to
victory. (see 2 Tim 2:22)

Remember temptation is not sin ~ Jesus was tempted three times in the dessert ~
Temptation only becomes a sin when you give into it ~
But in the same token do not flirt with temptation ~ like Paul says, run from it...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, give me swift and strong legs to run
from temptation. Help me to truly recognize people and situations
that would cause me to give into temptation...I pray for Your
Help in Jesus name...Amen. 

Keep looking up, do not ask the Lord to guide your 
footsteps if you refuse to move your feet...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Like the Corinthians we are living in a culture that is morally depraved with sin-inducing pressures. Paul has some encouragement He says: (1) Temptations happen to every one so don't feel you have been singled out. (2) Others have resisted temptation, and so can you. (3) Any temptation can be resisted because God will show you a way out. God will help you in resisting temptation by helping you: (1) Recognize those people and situations that give you trouble. (2) Run from anything you know is wrong. (3) Choose to do only what is right. (4) Pray for God's help ~ and (5) seek friends who love God and can offer help when you are tempted. Running from a tempting situation is your first step on the way to victory. (see 2 Timothy 2:22) Remember temptation is not sin ~ Jesus was tempted three times in the dessert ~ Temptation only becomes a sin when you give into it ~ But in the same token do not flirt with temptation ~ like Paul says, run from it.
original_verse_text: If you think you are standing firm, be careful that you do not fall! No temptation has seized you except what is common to man. And God is faithful; He will not let you be tempted beyond what you can bear. But when you are tempted, He will also provide a way out so that so that you can stand up under it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge the constant temptations that surround us in this fallen world. Help us to recognize the situations and people that lead us astray, and give us the strength to flee from anything that is displeasing in Your sight. May we seek the company of those who love You and can offer encouragement when we are weak. Guide us, Lord, that we may walk the path of righteousness and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Like the Corinthians we are living in a culture that is morally depraved with sin-inducing pressures. Paul has some encouragement He says: (1) Temptations happen to every one so don't feel you have been singled out. (2) Others have resisted temptation, and so can you. (3) Any temptation can be resisted because God will show you a way out. God will help you in resisting temptation by helping you: (1) Recognize those people and situations that give you trouble. (2) Run from anything you know is wrong. (3) Choose to do only what is right. (4) Pray for God's help ~ and (5) seek friends who love God and can offer help when you are tempted. Running from a tempting situation is your first step on the way to victory. (see 2 Timothy 2:22) Remember temptation is not sin ~ Jesus was tempted three times in the dessert ~ Temptation only becomes a sin when you give into it ~ But in the same token do not flirt with temptation ~ like Paul says, run from it.
subject: Resisting Temptation: God's Way Out
verse_text: If you think you are standing firm, be careful that you do not fall! No temptation has seized you except what is common to man. And God is faithful; He will not let you be tempted beyond what you can bear. But when you are tempted, He will also provide a way out so that so that you can stand up under it.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Take time to live ~ it is the secret of success...

Our Bible Verses For Today:

Therefore, My dear friends, flee from idolatry... Speak to
sensible people; judge for yourselves what I say...(I Cor. 10:14, 15) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Idol worship was the major expression of religion in Corinth. There were
several pagan temples in the city, and they were very popular...

The statues of wood or stone were not evil in themselves, but people 
gave them credit for what only God could do ~ such as provide good 
weather ~ crops ~ and children...

Idolatry, is still a serious problem today, but it takes a different form.
We don't put our trust in statues of wood and stone but in paper money
and plastic cards...

Putting our trust in anything but God is idolatry, Our modern idols are 
those symbols of power ~ pleasure ~ or prestige that we so highly
regard...

When we understand those contemporary parallels to idols ~ Paul says
we should flee from them...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercy.
Help me to recognize when I began to place things above 
you. Forgive me for my sins of thought word and deed...Amen.

Keep looking up, time is but the fringe of eternity...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Idol worship was the major expression of religion in Corinth. There were several pagan temples in the city, and they were very popular. The statues of wood or stone were not evil in themselves, but people gave them credit for what only God could do ~ such as provide good weather ~ crops ~ and children. Idolatry, is still a serious problem today, but it takes a different form. We don't put our trust in statues of wood and stone but in paper money and plastic cards. Putting our trust in anything but God is idolatry, Our modern idols are those symbols of power ~ pleasure ~ or prestige that we so highly regard. When we understand those contemporary parallels to idols ~ Paul says we should flee from them.
original_verse_text: Therefore, My dear friends, flee from idolatry. Speak to sensible people; judge for yourselves what I say.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, aware of the many idols that seek to captivate our hearts and distract us from worshiping You alone. Forgive us for the times we have placed our trust in the fleeting pleasures and possessions of this world, rather than in Your eternal and steadfast love. Help us to present our bodies as living sacrifices, holy and acceptable to You, and to be transformed by the renewing of our minds, that we may discern Your good, pleasing, and perfect will. May we flee from all forms of idolatry and cling to You, the one true God. Amen.
reflection: Idol worship was the major expression of religion in Corinth. There were several pagan temples in the city, and they were very popular. The statues of wood or stone were not evil in themselves, but people gave them credit for what only God could do ~ such as provide good weather ~ crops ~ and children. Idolatry, is still a serious problem today, but it takes a different form. We don't put our trust in statues of wood and stone but in paper money and plastic cards. Putting our trust in anything but God is idolatry, Our modern idols are those symbols of power ~ pleasure ~ or prestige that we so highly regard. When we understand those contemporary parallels to idols ~ Paul says we should flee from them.
subject: Flee from Modern Idols of Power
verse_text: Therefore, My dear friends, flee from idolatry. Speak to sensible people; judge for yourselves what I say.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~When God measures us He puts the tape
around our heart instead of our head...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Is not the cup of thanksgiving for which we give thanks a
participation in the blood of Christ? and is not the bread
that we break a participation in the body of Christ?

Because there is one loaf, we, who are many, are one
body, for we all partake of the one loaf...(I Cor. 10:16, 17) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The idea of unity and fellowship with God through eating a
sacrifice was strong in Judaism and Christianity as well as
in paganism...

In Old testament times, when a Jew offered a sacrifice, he
ate a part of that sacrifice as a way of restoring his unity
with God, against whom he had sinned (Deut. 12:17, 18).

Similarly we as Christians participate in Christ's once-for-all
sacrifice at the Lord's table when we eat the bread and drink 
the wine...

This symbolizes His body and blood...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, each time I come to Your Table help
me to remember to lay all my sins before you, so that I may
be worthy of receiving Your gifts...Amen.

Keep looking up, the Lord is looking down at your heart...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: The idea of unity and fellowship with God through eating a sacrifice was strong in Judaism and Christianity as well as in paganism. In Old testament times, when a Jew offered a sacrifice, he ate a part of that sacrifice as a way of restoring his unity with God, against whom he had sinned (Deuteronomy 12:17, 18). Similarly we as Christians participate in Christ's once-for-all sacrifice at the Lord's table when we eat the bread and drink the wine. This symbolizes His body and blood.
original_verse_text: Is not the cup of thanksgiving for which we give thanks a participation in the blood of Christ? and is not the bread that we break a participation in the body of Christ? Because there is one loaf, we, who are many, are one body, for we all partake of the one loaf.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the unity and fellowship we share through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. As we partake of the bread and the cup, may we be reminded of the deep connection we have with You and with one another as the body of Christ. May this sacred meal strengthen our faith and deepen our commitment to live in harmony, serving one another with love. We thank You for this precious gift. Amen.
reflection: The idea of unity and fellowship with God through eating a sacrifice was strong in Judaism and Christianity as well as in paganism. In Old testament times, when a Jew offered a sacrifice, he ate a part of that sacrifice as a way of restoring his unity with God, against whom he had sinned (Deuteronomy 12:17, 18). Similarly we as Christians participate in Christ's once-for-all sacrifice at the Lord's table when we eat the bread and drink the wine. This symbolizes His body and blood.
subject: Restored Unity Through Sacrifice
verse_text: Is not the cup of thanksgiving for which we give thanks a participation in the blood of Christ? and is not the bread that we break a participation in the body of Christ? Because there is one loaf, we, who are many, are one body, for we all partake of the one loaf.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~A selfless life reaps an eternal harvest...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

You can not drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons too;
you can not have a part in both the Lord's and the table of demons.
(I Cor. 10:21) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

As followers of Christ we must give Him our total allegiance.
We can not as Paul explains, have a part in "the cup of the 
Lord and...the cup of demons."

Eating at the Lord's table means communing with Christ and
identifying with His death...

Drinking from the cup of demons means identifying with Satan
by worshiping or promoting pagan (or evil) activities...

Are you leading two lives, trying to follow both Christ and the
crowd? The Bible tells us we can not do both at the same time.

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heaven Father, precious is Your love and redeeming power.
I pray that You will forgive me for straying from Your path. Make 
clear Your will for my life I pray in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, be not afraid God is with you wherever you go...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: As followers of Christ we must give Him our total allegiance. We can not as Paul explains, have a part in "the cup of the Lord and. the cup of demons." Eating at the Lord's table means communing with Christ and identifying with His death. Drinking from the cup of demons means identifying with Satan by worshiping or promoting pagan (or evil) activities. Are you leading two lives, trying to follow both Christ and the crowd? The Bible tells us we can not do both at the same time.
original_verse_text: You can not drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons too; you can not have a part in both the Lord's and the table of demons.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that we cannot serve both You and the ways of this world. Help us to fully surrender our lives to You, to commune with You at Your table, and to reject any allegiance to the powers of darkness. May we walk in the freedom and victory that comes from being united with Christ and His sacrifice. We desire to give You our complete devotion, Lord. Amen.
reflection: As followers of Christ we must give Him our total allegiance. We can not as Paul explains, have a part in "the cup of the Lord and. the cup of demons." Eating at the Lord's table means communing with Christ and identifying with His death. Drinking from the cup of demons means identifying with Satan by worshiping or promoting pagan (or evil) activities. Are you leading two lives, trying to follow both Christ and the crowd? The Bible tells us we can not do both at the same time.
subject: Allegiance to Christ Alone Matters
verse_text: You can not drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons too; you can not have a part in both the Lord's and the table of demons.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Stay in fellowship with other believers ~ Remember
the banana, when it left the bunch, it got skinned...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

"Everything is permissible" ~ but not everything is beneficial.
"Everything is permissible" ~ but not everything is constructive.

Nobody should seek his own good, but the good of others...
(I Cor. 10:23, 24) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Sometimes it is hard to know when to defer to the weak believer.
Paul gives us a simple rule of thumb, to help in making the decision:

We should be sensitive and gracious. While some actions may not 
be wrong, they may not be in the best interest of others...

While we have freedom in Christ, we shouldn't exercise our freedom
at the cost of hurting a Christian brother or sister,,,

We are not consider only our self; we must be sensitive to others...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to have a more loving spirit.
Help me to be more sensitive to the needs of others...Amen.

Keep looking up, to seek His will...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Sometimes it is hard to know when to defer to the weak believer. Paul gives us a simple rule of thumb, to help in making the decision: We should be sensitive and gracious. While some actions may not be wrong, they may not be in the best interest of others. While we have freedom in Christ, we shouldn't exercise our freedom at the cost of hurting a Christian brother or sister, , , We are not consider only our self; we must be sensitive to others.
original_verse_text: "Everything is permissible" ~ but not everything is beneficial."Everything is permissible" ~ but not everything is constructive. Nobody should seek his own good, but the good of others.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to be sensitive and gracious, not exercising our freedom in Christ at the cost of hurting our brothers and sisters. May we consider not only our own interests, but also the needs of others. Give us discernment to know when to defer, that we may build up the body of Christ and not cause anyone to stumble. Lord, make us instruments of Your love and unity. Amen.
reflection: Sometimes it is hard to know when to defer to the weak believer. Paul gives us a simple rule of thumb, to help in making the decision: We should be sensitive and gracious. While some actions may not be wrong, they may not be in the best interest of others. While we have freedom in Christ, we shouldn't exercise our freedom at the cost of hurting a Christian brother or sister, , , We are not consider only our self; we must be sensitive to others.
subject: Graciously Defer to the Weaker Believer
verse_text: "Everything is permissible" ~ but not everything is beneficial."Everything is permissible" ~ but not everything is constructive. Nobody should seek his own good, but the good of others.

original_content:
It's me again!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Your temper is like a fire. It gets very destructive
when it gets out of control. (Pro. 25:28)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul goes on to explain: Eat anything sold in the meat market 
without raising questions of conscience,

for, "The earth is the Lord's, and everything in it...

If some unbeliever invites you to a meal and you want to go, eat 
whatever is put before you without raising questions of conscience...
(I Cor. 10:25-27 NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul gave one answer to a dilemma: BUY whatever meat is sold
without asking whether or not it has been offered to idols. It doesn't
matter anyway, and no one's conscience would be bothered...

When we become to worried about our every action, we become 
legalistic and cannot enjoy life...

Remember everything belongs to God, and He has given us all things
to enjoy. If we know something is a problem, then we can deal with it,
but we don't need to go looking for problems...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, If I have wounded any soul today
if I have caused one foot to go astray, dear Lord, forgive...Amen.

Keep looking up, with Him all things are possible...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...
original_reflection_text: Paul gave one answer to a dilemma: BUY whatever meat is sold without asking whether or not it has been offered to idols. It doesn't matter anyway, and no one's conscience would be bothered. When we become to worried about our every action, we become legalistic and cannot enjoy life. Remember everything belongs to God, and He has given us all things to enjoy. If we know something is a problem, then we can deal with it, but we don't need to go looking for problems.
original_verse_text: Paul goes on to explain: Eat anything sold in the meat market without raising questions of conscience, for, "The earth is the Lord's, and everything in it. If some unbeliever invites you to a meal and you want to go, eat whatever is put before you without raising questions of conscience.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the freedom and joy You have given us in Christ. Help us not to become burdened by unnecessary rules and worries, but to receive with gratitude the good gifts You provide. May we walk in the Spirit, pursuing what leads to peace and mutual upbuilding, not stumbling over disputable matters. Give us wisdom to discern when to address concerns, and the grace to extend liberty to one another. In all things, may we honor You and enjoy the abundant life You have graciously offered. Amen.
reflection: Paul gave one answer to a dilemma: BUY whatever meat is sold without asking whether or not it has been offered to idols. It doesn't matter anyway, and no one's conscience would be bothered. When we become to worried about our every action, we become legalistic and cannot enjoy life. Remember everything belongs to God, and He has given us all things to enjoy. If we know something is a problem, then we can deal with it, but we don't need to go looking for problems.
subject: Enjoy Life Without Worrying over Trivialities
verse_text: Paul goes on to explain: Eat anything sold in the meat market without raising questions of conscience, for, "The earth is the Lord's, and everything in it. If some unbeliever invites you to a meal and you want to go, eat whatever is put before you without raising questions of conscience.

original_content:
Happy Fri.!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Remember decisions can take you out of God's
will but not out of His reach...(2 Tim 2:13).

Our Bible verses for Today:

Paul says, So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, 
do it all for the glory of God...

Do not cause anyone to stumble, whether Jews Greeks or the 
church of God ~ even as I try to please everybody in every way. 

For I am not seeking my own good but the good of many, so 
that they may be saved...( I Cor. 10:31-33) 

Our Lesson for Today:

I believe what we should understand here is that Paul's criterion for
all his actions was not necessarily what he liked best but what was
best for those around him...

The opposite approach would be:
(1) being sensitive and doing what we want no matter who is hurt by it.
(2) being oversensitive and doing nothing, for fear that someone may be displeased.
(3) being a "yes person" by going alone with everything, trying to gain approval
from people rather than God...

In this age of "me first" and "looking out for number one," Paul's startling
statement is a good standard. If we make the good of others one of
our primary goals, we will develop a serving attitude, thus pleasing God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for not always having a proper
attitude. Help me Lord to adjust my attitude, that it would become
more pleasing to You...Amen.

Keep looking up, it is a sure attitude that is pleasing to God...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: I believe what we should understand here is that Paul's criterion for all his actions was not necessarily what he liked best but what was best for those around him. The opposite approach would be: (1) being sensitive and doing what we want no matter who is hurt by it. (2) being oversensitive and doing nothing, for fear that someone may be displeased. (3) being a "yes person" by going alone with everything, trying to gain approval from people rather than God. In this age of "me first" and "looking out for number one, " Paul's startling statement is a good standard. If we make the good of others one of our primary goals, we will develop a serving attitude, thus pleasing God.
original_verse_text: Paul says, So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God. Do not cause anyone to stumble, whether Jews Greeks or the church of God ~ even as I try to please everybody in every way. For I am not seeking my own good but the good of many, so that they may be saved.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking to honor You in all that we do. Help us to follow the example of Your servant Paul, who put the needs of others before his own desires. May we develop a serving attitude, seeking to build up and encourage those around us, rather than selfishly pursuing our own interests. Guide us to make decisions that are pleasing to You, not just what is most convenient for us. We desire to be a people who live for Your glory, not our own. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: I believe what we should understand here is that Paul's criterion for all his actions was not necessarily what he liked best but what was best for those around him. The opposite approach would be: (1) being sensitive and doing what we want no matter who is hurt by it. (2) being oversensitive and doing nothing, for fear that someone may be displeased. (3) being a "yes person" by going alone with everything, trying to gain approval from people rather than God. In this age of "me first" and "looking out for number one, " Paul's startling statement is a good standard. If we make the good of others one of our primary goals, we will develop a serving attitude, thus pleasing God.
subject: Serving Others: a Godly Standard
verse_text: Paul says, So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God. Do not cause anyone to stumble, whether Jews Greeks or the church of God ~ even as I try to please everybody in every way. For I am not seeking my own good but the good of many, so that they may be saved.

original_content:
Have a Blessed Weekend!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Our friends are like elevator buttons.
They can either take us up or they will
take us down...(Pro. 13:20)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Paul says: Follow my example, as I follow the example of Christ.
(I Cor. 11:1)

Our Lesson for Today:

What was/is Paul's reasoning for following his example?

Remember ~ he did not think of himself as sinless so he wasn't
being arrogant...

Well we need to remember at the time he said this to the Corinthian people
they didn't know about the life and ministry of Christ. Paul could not tell them 
to imitate Jesus because the Gospels hadn't been written yet, so they didn't 
know what Jesus was like...

The best way to point these new Christians to Christ was to point them to a
Christian who they trusted...which we see in (Gal. 4:12; Phil. 3:17; 1 Thess. 1:6; 2:14)

Is there some non-Christian ~ someone that doesn't know the Good News yet
watching you?? Remember your life maybe the only Gospel they will ever read...

Keep looking up, He loves to make you wise unto salvation.
You are in the prayers of Two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: What was/is Paul's reasoning for following his example? Remember ~ he did not think of himself as sinless so he wasn't being arrogant. Well we need to remember at the time he said this to the Corinthian people they didn't know about the life and ministry of Christ. Paul could not tell them to imitate Jesus because the Gospels hadn't been written yet, so they didn't know what Jesus was like. The best way to point these new Christians to Christ was to point them to a Christian who they trusted. which we see in (Galatians 4:12; Philippians 3:17; 1 Thessalonians 1:6; 2:14)
original_verse_text: Paul says: Follow my example, as I follow the example of Christ.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the example of Your servant Paul, who humbly pointed others to follow him as he followed Christ. Help us to be imitators of those who, through their faith and obedience, have shown us the way to walk in Your footsteps. May we fix our eyes on Jesus, the author and perfecter of our faith, and strive to live lives that are pleasing to You. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: What was/is Paul's reasoning for following his example? Remember ~ he did not think of himself as sinless so he wasn't being arrogant. Well we need to remember at the time he said this to the Corinthian people they didn't know about the life and ministry of Christ. Paul could not tell them to imitate Jesus because the Gospels hadn't been written yet, so they didn't know what Jesus was like. The best way to point these new Christians to Christ was to point them to a Christian who they trusted. which we see in (Galatians 4:12; Philippians 3:17; 1 Thessalonians 1:6; 2:14)
subject: Imitate the Apostle Paul's Example
verse_text: Paul says: Follow my example, as I follow the example of Christ.

original_content:
Just Another Week!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~There is a name for people who are not excited
about their work ~ unemployed. (Col. 3:23)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Now I want you to realize that the head of every man is Christ,
and the head of the woman is man, and the head of Christ is 
God...(I Cor. 11:3)

Our Lesson for Today:

the phrase 'the head of the woman is man' does not indicate man's 
control or supremacy, but rather his being her source...

Because of the fact that man was created first, the woman derives her
existence from man, as man does from Christ and Christ from God...

I would have to say, the principal behind Paul's words is submission,
which is a key element in the smooth functioning of any business,
government, or family...

Why does there have to be submission? I believe God ordained 
submission in certain relationships to prevent chaos...

But it is also important to understand that submission is not surrender,
withdrawal, or apathy. it does not mean inferiority ~ because God created 
all people in His image and all have equal value...

'Submission" is 'mutual commitment' and 'cooperation...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for added wisdom and faith.
I realize that I will never totally understand all that there is
to know so I pray for added faith to accept what I do not 
understand...Amen.

Keep looking up, believing that God knows best...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: the phrase 'the head of the woman is man' does not indicate man's control or supremacy, but rather his being her source. Because of the fact that man was created first, the woman derives her existence from man, as man does from Christ and Christ from God. I would have to say, the principal behind Paul's words is submission, which is a key element in the smooth functioning of any business, government, or family. Why does there have to be submission? I believe God ordained submission in certain relationships to prevent chaos. But it is also important to understand that submission is not surrender, withdrawal, or apathy. it does not mean inferiority ~ because God created all people in His image and all have equal value. 'Submission" is 'mutual commitment' and 'cooperation.
original_verse_text: Now I want you to realize that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is man, and the head of Christ is God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the beautiful design of relationships and the order You have established. Help us to understand the true meaning of submission - not as a sign of inferiority, but as a mutual commitment to one another, rooted in Your perfect will. Grant us the wisdom to submit to You and to one another in love, that we may reflect the harmony found in the Godhead. May our relationships be marked by cooperation, not chaos. We ask this in the name of Christ, our head. Amen.
reflection: the phrase 'the head of the woman is man' does not indicate man's control or supremacy, but rather his being her source. Because of the fact that man was created first, the woman derives her existence from man, as man does from Christ and Christ from God. I would have to say, the principal behind Paul's words is submission, which is a key element in the smooth functioning of any business, government, or family. Why does there have to be submission? I believe God ordained submission in certain relationships to prevent chaos. But it is also important to understand that submission is not surrender, withdrawal, or apathy. it does not mean inferiority ~ because God created all people in His image and all have equal value. 'Submission" is 'mutual commitment' and 'cooperation.
subject: Submission: Mutual Commitment and Cooperation
verse_text: Now I want you to realize that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is man, and the head of Christ is God.

original_content:
Happy Tue.!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~A person's true character is best seen by what 
he does when no one is watching. (Eph. 6:6)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Man did not come from woman, but woman from man;

neither was man created for woman, but woman for man...
(I Cor. 11:8-9)

Our Lesson for Today:

God created lines of authority in order for His created world to function smoothly.
Although there must be lines of authority even in marriage, there should not be
lines of superiority...

God created men and women with unique and complementary characteristics.
One sex is not better that the other. We must not let the issue of authority and 
submission become a wedge to destroy oneness in marriage...

Instead, we should use our unique gifts to strengthen our marriages and to 
glorify God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your wisdom ~ grant us all 
a measure of wisdom, that there would be more love and unity in
the world. Open my heart and mind to Your perfect will...Amen.

Keep looking up, do all things unto the Lord...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: God created lines of authority in order for His created world to function smoothly. Although there must be lines of authority even in marriage, there should not be lines of superiority. God created men and women with unique and complementary characteristics. One sex is not better that the other. We must not let the issue of authority and submission become a wedge to destroy oneness in marriage. Instead, we should use our unique gifts to strengthen our marriages and to glorify God.
original_verse_text: Man did not come from woman, but woman from man; neither was man created for woman, but woman for man.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the beautiful design of marriage, where husband and wife are called to submit to one another out of reverence for Christ. Help us to embrace the unique and complementary roles You have ordained, not as a means of superiority, but as a way to build up our oneness and bring glory to Your name. May our marriages reflect the selfless love of Christ and the Church. Amen.
reflection: God created lines of authority in order for His created world to function smoothly. Although there must be lines of authority even in marriage, there should not be lines of superiority. God created men and women with unique and complementary characteristics. One sex is not better that the other. We must not let the issue of authority and submission become a wedge to destroy oneness in marriage. Instead, we should use our unique gifts to strengthen our marriages and to glorify God.
subject: Unique and Complementary Roles in Marriage
verse_text: Man did not come from woman, but woman from man; neither was man created for woman, but woman for man.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~It is better to die with a good name
than to live with a bad one...(Eccl. 7:1)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

In the following directives I have no praise for you, for your meetings
do more harm than good...

In the first place, I hear that when you come together as a church, there
are divisions among you, and to some extent I believe it...

No doubt there have been differences among you to show which of you
have God's approval...(I Cor. 11:17-19) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul acknowledges that there will be differences among
church members. When church members develop into
self-willed divisions, they will become destructive to the
congregation...

Those who cause divisions only serve to highlight those
who are genuine believers...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father, I pray that the believers of a church
would become a light onto there communities. I pray that
there would be no divisions among the members. Help us
as believers to be the salt and the light...Amen.

Keep looking up, let your light shine...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Paul acknowledges that there will be differences among church members. When church members develop into self-willed divisions, they will become destructive to the congregation. Those who cause divisions only serve to highlight those who are genuine believers.
original_verse_text: In the following directives I have no praise for you, for your meetings do more harm than good. In the first place, I hear that when you come together as a church, there are divisions among you, and to some extent I believe it. No doubt there have been differences among you to show which of you have God's approval.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the diversity within Your Church. Help us to see our differences not as sources of division, but as opportunities to grow in unity and understanding. May we resist the temptation of self-will and instead seek to build up one another, recognizing that we are all members of the same body, united in Christ. Guide us to discern the genuine believers from those who would sow discord, that Your Church may stand firm in the face of any challenge. We pray for the wisdom and grace to maintain the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace. Amen.
reflection: Paul acknowledges that there will be differences among church members. When church members develop into self-willed divisions, they will become destructive to the congregation. Those who cause divisions only serve to highlight those who are genuine believers.
subject: Embracing Unity Midst Diversity
verse_text: In the following directives I have no praise for you, for your meetings do more harm than good. In the first place, I hear that when you come together as a church, there are divisions among you, and to some extent I believe it. No doubt there have been differences among you to show which of you have God's approval.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~"No" is one word that can never be 
misunderstood. (Mt. 5:37a)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

When you come together, it is not the Lord's Supper you eat,

for as you eat, each of you goes ahead without waiting for
anybody else, One remains hungry, and others get drunk...

Don't you have homes to eat and drink in? Or do you despise 
the church of God and humiliate those who have nothing?
What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you for this? Certainly 
not! (I Cor. 11:20-22) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

When the Lord's Supper was celebrated in the early church,
it included a feast or fellowship meal followed by the celebration
of communion...

In the church at Corinth, the fellowship meal had become a time 
when some ate and drank excessively while others went hungry.
There was little sharing and caring...

This certainly did not demonstrate the unity and love that should 
characterize the church, nor was it a preparation for communion.
Paul condemned these actions and reminded the church of the
real purpose of the Lord's Supper...

How do you approach the Lord's Supper? Is it just something that
others are doing so you follow suit? Or do you approach with a 
repentant heart? Examine your reasoning before you approach
God's table next time...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for the times I have given
very little thought to the significance of Your Holy Supper.
Help me to remember to seek Your cleansing each time I
partake of the Holy Communion...Amen.

Keep looking up, for His cleansing...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: When the Lord's Supper was celebrated in the early church, it included a feast or fellowship meal followed by the celebration of communion. In the church at Corinth, the fellowship meal had become a time when some ate and drank excessively while others went hungry. There was little sharing and caring. This certainly did not demonstrate the unity and love that should characterize the church, nor was it a preparation for communion. Paul condemned these actions and reminded the church of the real purpose of the Lord's Supper. How do you approach the Lord's Supper? Is it just something that others are doing so you follow suit? Or do you approach with a repentant heart? Examine your reasoning before you approach God's table next time.
original_verse_text: When you come together, it is not the Lord's Supper you eat, for as you eat, each of you goes ahead without waiting for anybody else, One remains hungry, and others get drunk. Don't you have homes to eat and drink in? Or do you despise the church of God and humiliate those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you for this? Certainly not!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to honor and glorify You through the celebration of the Lord's Supper. Forgive us for the times when we have approached this sacred meal without the proper reverence and care for one another. Help us to remember the unity and love that should characterize Your church, and to approach Your table with repentant hearts, ready to receive the grace and nourishment You offer. May our fellowship be a reflection of the unity we share in Christ. In Your name we pray, Amen.
reflection: When the Lord's Supper was celebrated in the early church, it included a feast or fellowship meal followed by the celebration of communion. In the church at Corinth, the fellowship meal had become a time when some ate and drank excessively while others went hungry. There was little sharing and caring. This certainly did not demonstrate the unity and love that should characterize the church, nor was it a preparation for communion. Paul condemned these actions and reminded the church of the real purpose of the Lord's Supper. How do you approach the Lord's Supper? Is it just something that others are doing so you follow suit? Or do you approach with a repentant heart? Examine your reasoning before you approach God's table next time.
subject: The Lord's Supper: a Time for Reflection
verse_text: When you come together, it is not the Lord's Supper you eat, for as you eat, each of you goes ahead without waiting for anybody else, One remains hungry, and others get drunk. Don't you have homes to eat and drink in? Or do you despise the church of God and humiliate those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you for this? Certainly not!

original_content:
Fri. is here!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~There are those who complain because God put thorns on
roses, but others praise God for putting roses among the thorns.
(Phil 4:8)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

When He had given thanks, He broke the bread and said, "This
is My body, which is for you; do this in remembrance of Me."

In the same way, after supper He took the cup, saying."This cup
is the new covenant in My blood; do this, whenever you drink it, in
remembrance of Me."

For whenever you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim 
the Lord's death until He comes...

Therefore, whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord in
an unworthy manner will be guilty of sinning against the body and 
blood of the Lord...(I Cor. 11:24-27)

Our Lesson for Today:

Jesus said, "Do this in remembrance of Me as often as you 
drink of it." How do we remember Christ in the Lord's Supper?

By thinking about what He did and why He did it... If the Lord's
Supper becomes just a ritual or a pious habit, it no longer celebrates
Christ's death, and loses its significance...

We should examine ourselves for any unconfused sins or resentful
attitude (grudges) before we come to the Lord's table...If we have not
we eat and drink condemnation unto ourselves...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord I pray that you would bring to mind any unconfused 
sin before I partake of the Lord's Supper. Cleanse me from all 
unrighteousness...Amen.

Keep looking up, and He will bring to mind your need of confession...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Jesus said, "Do this in remembrance of Me as often as you drink of it." How do we remember Christ in the Lord's Supper? By thinking about what He did and why He did it. If the Lord's Supper becomes just a ritual or a pious habit, it no longer celebrates Christ's death, and loses its significance. We should examine ourselves for any unconfused sins or resentful attitude (grudges) before we come to the Lord's table. If we have not we eat and drink condemnation unto ourselves.
original_verse_text: When He had given thanks, He broke the bread and said, "This is My body, which is for you; do this in remembrance of Me." In the same way, after supper He took the cup, saying."This cup is the new covenant in My blood; do this, whenever you drink it, in remembrance of Me." For whenever you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord's death until He comes. Therefore, whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of sinning against the body and blood of the Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, remembering the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. As we partake of the Lord's Supper, may we not simply go through the motions, but truly reflect on the depth of Your love and the forgiveness we have received through Christ's death on the cross. Cleanse us from any unconfessed sin or resentful attitude, that we may approach Your table with reverence and humility. May this sacred meal be a time of renewal, as we celebrate the new life we have in You. Amen.
reflection: Jesus said, "Do this in remembrance of Me as often as you drink of it." How do we remember Christ in the Lord's Supper? By thinking about what He did and why He did it. If the Lord's Supper becomes just a ritual or a pious habit, it no longer celebrates Christ's death, and loses its significance. We should examine ourselves for any unconfused sins or resentful attitude (grudges) before we come to the Lord's table. If we have not we eat and drink condemnation unto ourselves.
subject: Remember Christ's Sacrifice in the Supper
verse_text: When He had given thanks, He broke the bread and said, "This is My body, which is for you; do this in remembrance of Me." In the same way, after supper He took the cup, saying."This cup is the new covenant in My blood; do this, whenever you drink it, in remembrance of Me." For whenever you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord's death until He comes. Therefore, whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of sinning against the body and blood of the Lord.

original_content:
Thank God for Sat!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The cure for crime is not in the electric chair,
but in the high chair...(Pro. 22:6)

Our Bible Verses for Today:
(one over lap from yesterdays Dev.)

If anyone eats this bread or drinks this cup of the Lord unworthily,
that person is guilty of sinning against the body and blood of the Lord...

That is why you should examine yourselves before eating the bread 
and drinking from the cup...

For if you eat the bread or drink the cup unworthily, not honoring the body 
of Christ, you are eating and drinking God's judgment on yourself...

That is why many of you are weak and sick and some have died...
(I Cor. 11:27-30) NLT

Our Lesson for Today:

When Paul said that no one should take the Lord's Supper unworthily,
he was speaking to the church members who were participating in it
without thinking of its meaning...

Those who did and still do are "guilty of sinning against the body and the
blood of the Lord."

Instead of honoring His sacrifice, we are sharing in the guilt of those who
crucified Christ...

In reality, no one is worthy to take the Lord's Supper ~ We are all sinners
saved by grace. This is why we should prepare ourselves for Communion
through healthy Introspection, confession of sin, and a true resolution of
differences with others...

These actions remove the barriers that affect our relationship with Christ
and with other believers...

Awareness of your sins should not keep you away from the Communion table
but drive you to confess and then drive you to participate...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to examine myself totally 
each time I come to Your table that I might not sin against
You. Wash me white as snow...Amen.

Keep looking up, and receive His cleansing...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: When Paul said that no one should take the Lord's Supper unworthily, he was speaking to the church members who were participating in it without thinking of its meaning. Those who did and still do are "guilty of sinning against the body and the blood of the Lord." Instead of honoring His sacrifice, we are sharing in the guilt of those who crucified Christ. In reality, no one is worthy to take the Lord's Supper ~ We are all sinners saved by grace. This is why we should prepare ourselves for Communion through healthy Introspection, confession of sin, and a true resolution of differences with others. These actions remove the barriers that affect our relationship with Christ and with other believers. Awareness of your sins should not keep you away from the Communion table but drive you to confess and then drive you to participate.
original_verse_text: (one over lap from yesterdays Dev. ) If anyone eats this bread or drinks this cup of the Lord unworthily, that person is guilty of sinning against the body and blood of the Lord. That is why you should examine yourselves before eating the bread and drinking from the cup. For if you eat the bread or drink the cup unworthily, not honoring the body of Christ, you are eating and drinking God's judgment on yourself. That is why many of you are weak and sick and some have died.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging our unworthiness to partake of the Lord's Supper. Yet, we are grateful for Your boundless grace and the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who died for our sins. Help us to approach this sacred meal with reverence and sincerity, examining our hearts and confessing our sins, that we may honor the body and blood of our Lord. May this Communion strengthen our relationship with You and with one another, as we seek to live in unity and love. We thank You for Your unending mercy and the gift of salvation. Amen.
reflection: When Paul said that no one should take the Lord's Supper unworthily, he was speaking to the church members who were participating in it without thinking of its meaning. Those who did and still do are "guilty of sinning against the body and the blood of the Lord." Instead of honoring His sacrifice, we are sharing in the guilt of those who crucified Christ. In reality, no one is worthy to take the Lord's Supper ~ We are all sinners saved by grace. This is why we should prepare ourselves for Communion through healthy Introspection, confession of sin, and a true resolution of differences with others. These actions remove the barriers that affect our relationship with Christ and with other believers. Awareness of your sins should not keep you away from the Communion table but drive you to confess and then drive you to participate.
subject: Prepare Your Heart for Communion
verse_text: (one over lap from yesterdays Dev. ) If anyone eats this bread or drinks this cup of the Lord unworthily, that person is guilty of sinning against the body and blood of the Lord. That is why you should examine yourselves before eating the bread and drinking from the cup. For if you eat the bread or drink the cup unworthily, not honoring the body of Christ, you are eating and drinking God's judgment on yourself. That is why many of you are weak and sick and some have died.
